themes: perceived corruption and favoritism in funding allocation
lack of impact from funded organizations
disconnect between funding decisions and actual arts needs
key_phrases: action taken against the Museum of Human Achievement for receiving nearly 700k by gaming the system
staff not allow for double dipping and having their friends receive the largest awards
the people that agree with them seemed to have inherited the purse
funds made next to no impact
arts are the single hardest thing to generate income for
art matters, who it reaches matters
barriers_identified: perceived favoritism and nepotism in funding decisions
organizations receiving funds without delivering impact
unsustainable funding models that set organizations up for failure
solutions_proposed: take action against organizations that game the system
prevent staff from enabling double dipping and favoritism
ensure funding models are sustainable and based on actual organizational capacity
